sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a circle.
message_1: What is the perimeter of a circle with a radius of 8 centimeters? Round your answer to the nearest hundredth.
message_2:
The perimeter of a circle, also known as the circumference, can be calculated using the formula C = 2πr, where C is the circumference and r is the radius.

In this case, the radius (r) is 8 centimeters. Plugging this value into the formula, we get:

C = 2π(8)
C ≈ 2(3.14)(8)
C ≈ 50.24

So, the perimeter (circumference) of the circle is approximately 50.24 centimeters, rounded to the nearest hundredth.
